text.section: On or after February 24, 1996, an owner of an affected property shall give to the tenant of the affected property a notice, prepared by the Department, of the tenant's rights under §§ 6-817 and 6-819 of this subtitle upon the execution of a lease or the inception of a tenancy.

An owner of an affected property shall give to the tenant of the affected property a notice, prepared by the Department, of the tenant's rights under §§ 6-817 and 6-819 of this subtitle at least every 2 years after last giving the notice to the tenant.

The owner shall include, with the notice of the tenant's rights that is provided to a tenant under this section upon the execution of a lease or the inception of a tenancy, a copy of the current verified inspection certificate for the affected property prepared under § 6-818 of this subtitle.

section.section:
Notice given under this section shall be written, and shall be sent by:
Certified mail, return receipt requested; or
A verifiable method approved by the Department.
When giving notice to a tenant under this section, the owner shall provide documentation of the notice to the Department in a manner acceptable to the Department.

A notice required to be given to a tenant under this section shall be sent to a party or parties identified as the lessee in a written lease in effect for an affected property or, if there is no written lease, the party or parties to whom the property was rented.

text.section:
A person who has acquired, or will acquire, an affected property shall give the notice required under this section to the tenant of the affected property:
Before transfer of legal title; or
Within 15 days following transfer of legal title.
